info.title: Resource Inventory Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Resource Inventory Management specification

parameters.name: fields

parameters.name: publicIdentifier
parameters.description: For filtering: Public Identifier for the resources e.g 07564534677.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: For filtering: A string used to give a name to the resource

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: For filtering: A string. Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

parameters.name: @type
parameters.description: For filtering: Indicates the (class) type of resource. For physical resource this will be 'Equipment', For logical Resource this can be 'Resource Function' , 'MSISDN', 'IP Address'.

parameters.name: @baseType
parameters.description: For filtering: Indicates the immediate base (class) type of the resource. For resources pf type 'Equipment', baseType can be 'PhysicalResource'.

parameters.description: For filtering: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

parameters.name: manufactureDate
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string attribute that defines the date of manufacture of this item in the fixed format "dd/mm/yyyy". This is an optional attribute.

parameters.name: powerState
parameters.description:
For filtering: This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify different instances of the same hardware item. The ModelNumber and PartNumber attributes are used to identify different types of hardware items. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: For filtering: This is a string that identifies the version of this object. This is an optional attribute.

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

LogicalResource.description: Logic resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete logical resources (e.g. TPE, MSISDN, IP Addresses) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

category.description: A string. Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

@baseType.description: Indicates the immediate base (class) type of the resource. For resources pf type 'Equipment', baseType can be 'PhysicalResource'.

validFor.description: The period for which the resource is valid

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

manufactureDate.description: This is a string attribute that defines the date of manufacture of this item in the fixed format "dd/mm/yyyy". This is an optional attribute.

powerState.description:
This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

serialNumber.description: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify different instances of the same hardware item. The ModelNumber and PartNumber attributes are used to identify different types of hardware items. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

versionNumber.description: This is a string that identifies the version of this object. This is an optional attribute.

Resource_Update.description:
Resource is an abstract entity that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete resources (e.g. TPE, EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.
Skipped properties: id,href,id,href,@type,@baseType

publicIdentifier.description: Public Identifier for the resources e.g 07564534677.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

category.description: A string. Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

lifecycleState.description: The life cycle state of the resource.

version.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

validFor.description: The period for which the resource is valid

TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

type.description:
Linked Resources to the one instantiate, it can be :
- "reliesOn" if the Resource needs another already owned Resource to rely on 
- "targets" or "isTargeted" (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

PlaceRef.description: Place reference. Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as "Paris Store", "London Store", "Main Home"

role.description: Role of the place (for instance: 'home delivery', 'shop retrieval')

PartyRoleRef.description: Party role reference. A party role represents the part played by a party in a given context.

name.description: The name of the referred party role.

partyId.description: The identifier of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

partyName.description: The name of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

ResourceSpecificationRef.description: Resource Specification reference: The ResourceSpecification is required to realize a ProductSpecification.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource specification

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of ResourceSpecification.  For resource baseType LogicalResource this can be 'LogicalResource Specification'

ResourceAttachmentRef.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

type.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

Note.description: Extra information about a given entity

RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

validFor.description: Validity period of the related party

code.description: An integer coding the error type. This is given to caller so he can translate them if required.

message.description: A short localized string that describes the error.

description.description: (optional) A long localized error description if needed. It can contain precise information about which parameter is missing, or what are the identifier acceptable values.

infoURL.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.
